basis

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • basis.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AntGame

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game is the class that should be overloaded to create a new game type. For instance, if you want your bots to be able to play a chess game, then create a ChessGame class which implements the Game class and overloads its methods according to the game specifications.
    Author:
    Nicolas

    • Field Detail

      • bots

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Bot> bots
        The list of bots in the game. If a bot was kicked during the match, it remains in this list but no longer receives server messages for this game until the match ends.

      • botInfos

        protected java.util.Map<Bot,BotGameInfo> botInfos
        The informations relative to bots required for the game.

      • ready

        private boolean ready
        Whether all bots that should play during the current round have sent their game actions. This boolean can be tested to stop waiting for game actions when the game won't receive those anymore.

      • loadTimeMs

        protected int loadTimeMs
        The time the server has to wait after "gamestart" message. (in milliseconds)

      • responseTimeMs

        protected int responseTimeMs
        The time of response a bot should respect to send its "gameactions" message after a "gamestate" message from the server. (in milliseconds)

      • curRound

        protected int curRound
        The current round identifier of the game.

      • maxRound

        protected int maxRound
        The maximum round count of the game. Can be set to -1 for unlimited round count.

        public Game()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Initializes the game state.

      • terminate

        public abstract void terminate()
        Terminates the game and cleans it.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns whether the current game state matches the game ending conditions.
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished, false otherwise.

      • computeBotScores

        public void computeBotScores()
        Updates the score of each bot based on its final game score. You can overload this method if you want a more specific score calculation.
        See Also:
        rating system

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Updates the game state.

      • muteBot

        public void muteBot(Bot bot,
                    java.lang.String reason)
        Mutes a bot in this game and sends it a "gamemute" message.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot to mute.
        reason - a message explaining why the bot was muted.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamemute.html

      • muteNonPlayerBots

        public void muteNonPlayerBots()
        Mutes the bots that did not send their actions during the current round.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamemute.html

      • executeActions

        protected abstract void executeActions(Bot bot,
                                       org.json.JSONObject content)
                                throws org.json.JSONException
        Executes the actions of a bot. You should implement this method to update your game state according to the actions a the bot.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot which gave the actions.
        content - the content of the "gameactions" message.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the actions object is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gameactions.html

      • receiveActions

        public int receiveActions(Bot bot,
                          org.json.JSONObject content)
                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives the actions of a bot for the current round. Returns the error ID associated with the message: 104 if the bot was too late to give its actions, 103 when the bot is playing whereas it's not its turn, 102 when the bot was muted for the game, 0 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot who gave the actions.
        content - the content of the "gameactions" message.
        Returns:
        the error ID of the "gameactions" message.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gameactions.html

      • sendGameState

        private void sendGameState(Bot bot,
                           boolean canPlay)
        Sends the current game state to a bot. A bot which receives a "gamestate" message is supposed to return its game action within the imposed response delay.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot that will receive the "gamestate" message.
        canPlay - whether the bot can play for this round. The bot is then supposed to play the game by returning a "gameactions" message within the alloted response time.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamestate.html

      • sendGameState

        public void sendGameState()
        Sends the current game state to the bot(s). By default, the method is implemented to send the game state and wait for game actions to every bot playing in game.

      • sendGameStart

        public void sendGameStart()
        Sends a "gamestart" message to all the bots in the game.

      • sendGameEnd

        public void sendGameEnd()
        Sends a "gameend" message to all the bots in the game.

      • genGameStateMessageContent

        protected abstract org.json.JSONObject genGameStateMessageContent(Bot bot)
        Generates the content of a "gamestate" message for a specific bot.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot that will receive the message.
        Returns:
        the content of the "gamestate" message.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamestate.html

      • getBotIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Bot> getBotIterator()
        Gets an iterator that iterates over bots in this game.
        Returns:
        an iterator from the bot list.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns whether the game is ready to update itself for the current round.
        Returns:
        true if all bots have played, false otherwise.

        public int getLoadTimeMs()
        Gets the time the server has to wait after "gamestart" message.
        Returns:
        the time to wait after a "gamestart" message.

      • getResponseTimeMs

        public int getResponseTimeMs()
        Gets he time the server has to wait for receiving "gameactions" message.
        Returns:
        the time to wait for bot actions.
